Name : 10 Pips Per Day Scalping Strategy
How to make 10 pips per day in Forex
First you want to setup your charts as the image above. If you want the Stochastic indicator like mine
column2: you can find it in the forums. Now the key is not to earn 10 pips in one shot or in one trade. If the trade skyrockets and gives you 10 pips
column4: take what you can get. I will post a video tutorial on this also to make it easier to understand. The risk to reward ratio on this strategy is bad but has a higher accuracy rate. So please trade at your own discretion.

column1: Steps to look for to scalp your 10 pips
- Look only on the major pairs. (EURUSD
column2: USDJPY

column1: - A close must happen outside the Bollinger Band indicator
- Stochastic Oscillator indicator must be in a oversold (below 20) or overbought area (above 80).
- If market is in a uptrend
column2: look for a red candle. If market is in a downtrend look for a green candle.

column1: - We will call these the “Signal Candles”
- Once you see your signal candle
column2: enter in that same direction and scalp your pips.

column1: - Stops are hard kept at 20 pips.

column1: Name : The Mumbai Forex Scalper Strategy
Strategy by : Analyst Navin Prithyani on UrbanForex.com

column2: I got a chance to visit Mumbai and experience the hustle and bustle of this financial juggernaut of India.

column1: The pace is very fast and everyone is trying to make a quick buck - very similar to our scalpers in the Forex industry.
This is the reason why I've called this strategy The Mumbai Forex Scalper Strategy.
We can start off by opening a 15 minute chart on your desired pair
column2: preferably forex pair with low spreads.

column1: Attach the Parabolic SAR with the settings mentioned above The Parabolic SAR can be used by giving us a sense of direction similar to a moving average.
Once we find a trend in the market
column2: we want to keep an look out for a cross in the Stochastic Oscillator to confirm the entry.

column1: If the Parabolic SAR is in a downtrend we need to wait for a confirmation of the Stochastic Oscillator to cross above the 70 level.
Once these two criterias are confirmed
column2: we would enter at the opening of the next candle. The stops can be kept on the high of the previous candle or can be adjusted/tweeked as per your risk appetite.

column1: If the Parabolic SAR is in a uptrend we need to wait for a confirmation of the Stochastic Oscillator to cross below the 30 level.
Once these two criterias are confirmed
column2: we would enter at the opening of the next candle. The stops can be kept on the low of the previous candle or can be adjusted/tweeked as per your risk appetite.

column1: 1:1 Risk to reward. If your stop is -12 pips your limit should be +12 pips.
Open 2 lots. If your stop is at -10 pips
column2: once your trades goes in your favor and you’re at +10 pips
column3: close 1 lot and let the other one run. Exit at Support and Resistance levels.

column1: Exit at the nearest 50 or 00 level. These are psychological levels. (make sure your exit is at least the same number of pips as your stop
column2: otherwise dont enter the trade)

column1: Trailing Stop. Once in a trade
column2: at the close of each candle
column3: place your stop 1 pip below the low (if in a buy trade). Vise versa for sell trade.

column1: Name : Singapore Swing Forex Trading Strategy

column2: Forex Trend (20

column1: Singapore has grown over the years with its ability to make the right decisions at the right time. Looking at this conservative giant
column2: I created this strategy that allows a trader to wait for the right time and capture a trend reversal.

column1: Load up any currency pair that has a low spread
column2: preferably any of the majors
column3: and set the trading time frame to 15 minutes.

column1: Then proceed to attached the Trendline file which you have downloaded and the Relative Strength Index with the settings mentioned above. Place 70 and 30 levels onto your RSI settings.
Once the market is trending down / short
column2: we need the RSI to cross below level 30.

column1: Wait for the close of a candle above the 2 Red Lines.
Then confirm that the RSI went from below level 30 to above 30 as showed in the image.
At the opening of the next candle
column2: a Long / Buy trade is opened. The stops can be kept at the swing low of the previous candle or at any level based on your risk appetite.

column1: Once the market is trending up / long
column2: we need the RSI to cross above level 70. Wait for the close of a candle below the 2 Blue Lines.  Then confirm that the RSI went from above level 70 to below 70 as showed in the image. At the opening of the next candle
column3: a Short / Sell trade is opened. The stops can be kept at the swing high of the previous candle or at any level based on your risk appetite.

column1: 1:1 Risk to reward. If your stop is -12 pips your limit should be +12 pips.
Open 2 lots. If your stop is at -10 pips
column2: once your trades goes in your favor and you’re at +10 pips
column3: close 1 lot and let the other one run. Exit at Support and Resistance levels.

column1: Exit at the nearest 50 or 00 level. These are psychological levels. (make sure your exit is at least the same number of pips as your stop
column2: otherwise dont enter the trade)

column1: Trailing Stop. Once in a trade
column2: at the close of each candle
column3: place your stop 1 pip below the low (if in a buy trade). Vise versa for sell trade.
